info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 15 at 5:02AM PST until November 15 at 8:15AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Southeastern Ventura County.
* WHEN...Until 815 AM PST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 458 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling over the southern California bight and heading towards Ventura County through 530 am. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.9 and 3 inches of rain have fallen with this storm, with heavy rainfall rates potentially exceeding 0.50 inch per hour later this morning. - Flash flood warnings will likely be needed due to heavy rainfall associated with this band of rainfall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Camarillo, Fillmore, Moorpark, Santa Paula, Newbury Park, Point Mugu State Park, Piru, and omis. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM PST THIS MORNING
